attributes.action: call in and overturn the decision made to allow property developments in London which will cause substantial reductions in the famous and protected views of St Paul's Cathedral and Westminster from places such as Parliament Hill, Westminster Pier, Greenwich and Richmond Park.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The 300 year old views stretching fom Richmond Park to St Paul's Cathedral are to be severely impaired after the Secretary of State for Communities and Local Government has approved a request made by the London Mayor to allow the building of massive commercial developments in sensitive and historic parts of London.  
This is just one of some ten substantial reductions in the previously protected views of St Paul's Cathedral.
The government should appreciate that a key factor in making London the world's favourite financial centre is its general environment, its heritage of historic buildings and the stunning views across the city.  
Even if there was a valid demand for such development, there are parts of London in real need of such investment (such as in East London stretching to the Thames Gateway).  
This unprecedented and short sighted approval to such poorly placed development will be immensely damaging to London and its environment if it is allowed to stand.  We petition that the decision be called in by the Prime Minister and overturned.
